lines.text: What's the matter with you? You got a face a foot long.
You look as if you just lost your best friend.
I'm my best friend.
That's what I said.
You don't know what a love affair is.
It's what goes on between a man and a .45 pistol that won't jam.
I'm just shopping. They got some new records in. Do you like Bop?
Bop? Is that where everybody plays a different tune at the same time?
You just haven't heard enough of it.
Prayer's not gonna keep you from being killed.
People don't pray to keep from dying. They pray to keep from being disappointed when they do.
You can rob Fort Knox and live, but steal a dime and kill a post office man, and they'll spend a million and a lifetime lookin' for you.
How many nuns are there anyway?
I don't know, Mr. Goddard. I never counted them.
And remember one thing, Al. The biggest thing on your side isn't a pair of brass knuckles. It's time and men and patience.

[Dryly]
Thanks, and now do you mind if I find out who killed Harry Gruber?
No. No, I'm sure you will, Al, because you're a good cop. But that's about all you are.
You don't think very much of me, do you?
I think of everything, Mr. Goddard, but I feel sorry for you. I don't think you have a heart.
Call it muscle. That's the way it is for a cop.
I don't believe you.
When a cop dies, they don't listen to his heart fade. It's a charley horse in the chest.
I'll remember you in my prayers.
Well, if I haven't anything else, i've got a good lawyer.
Anybody ever tell you about murder? It's against the law.
Can I give you a lift?
You already have.
I don't get it, Goddard. You go along one way for years, and all of a sudden you pull a complete switch. Why?
Sooner or later every rooster wants to lay an egg.
You're gonna take this Maxie's word? If somebody gave him a Bible to swear on, he'd steal it.
You afraid of me, Al?
Doesn't Earl ever get jealous?
He understands. You can put strings on good women or bad women. But you can't do anything about lazy ones.
You can beat 'em.
They stay about the same. You can't make 'em do the right thing, or the wrong thing. They're lazy. They do the *easy* thing.
[nestles close for a kiss, then promptly springs up from Al's lap when Earl's voice is heard in hallway. Brightly]
Saved by the bell!
That... is the story of my life.
Ten years in jail is sure gonna help my love life.
It's more romantic than being dead.
Do you know, Mr. Goddard, with a little practice, you could be a nice man.
I'll take two weeks off some time and try it.
